verses.text: The allotment for the descendants of Joseph went from the Jordan near Jericho, to the waters of Jericho on the east, then up through the wilderness from Jericho into the hill country of Bethel.
verses.comment: Geographical locations preserved; 'children of Joseph' refers to Ephraim and Manasseh.

verses.text: From Bethel it went out to Luz, and continued to Ataroth, the territory of the Archites.
verses.comment: Bethel and Luz are traditionally seen as the same city; Ataroth and Archites preserved from original wording.

verses.text: So the descendants of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, received their inheritance.
verses.comment: Clarifies Joseph's descendants are Ephraim and Manasseh; kept the redundancy of the wording.

verses.text: The border of the descendants of Ephraim according to their clans was as follows: the eastern boundary of their inheritance began at Ataroth-addar, as far as Upper Beth-horon.
verses.comment: Details preserved per tradition; 'by their clans' refers to the Hebrew mishpachot (families).

verses.text: Then the border went out westward at Michmethath on the north, turned eastward to Taanath-shiloh, and passed beyond it to Janoah.
verses.comment: Hebrew place names kept for accuracy.

verses.text: From Janoah it went down to Ataroth and Naarah, touched Jericho, and ended at the Jordan.
verses.comment: Border markers maintained; 'touched Jericho' reflects proximity to the city.

verses.text: From Tappuah the boundary went westward to the brook of Kanah, and ended at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the descendants of Ephraim by their clans.
verses.comment: Repeated phrase 'inheritance' matches the original emphasis.

verses.text: Along with the cities set apart for the descendants of Ephraim that were in the midst of the inheritance of the descendants of Manassehâ€”all the cities with their villages.
verses.comment: 'Set apart' means those cities given to Ephraim within Manasseh's territory.

verses.text: But they did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer; so the Canaanites have lived among the descendants of Ephraim to this day, but have been forced to work as laborers.
verses.comment: Clarifies original sense: Canaanites remained as forced labor. 'Laborers' translates Hebrew 'mas', meaning conscripted workers.
